runs.comm: straight from the Test match.. nice lines outside off, left alone
gets a thick outside edge as he looks to drive this one. He doesn't really reach out but this safely flies through the vacant third slip area
first baller for Kane Williamson! It's fuller and it's heading towards the middle stump, Williamson looked to flick it but he knew he was a gonner once he missed it. No chance there at all.
he angles this one away from the left-hander, left alone
on the pads, Devcich is slow on the flick shot but gets off strike as the ball rolls to the leg side after hitting the pads
comes forward and rides the bounce to punch it through off, finds the fielder at cover
he dabs it towards cover with soft hands and is called for a single by a charging Guptill
whoa!! it's a flick of the wrists and this has gone higher than the Burj Khalifa.. Clears the boundary at cow corner easily
now cuts this short and wide delivery with a lot of power but finds the man at point
wrong lines, it's on the pads and easily flicked to deep square leg but there is protection down there
stays in the crease and turns the back of length delivery towards midwicket
they are missing the straight ones! Tanvir floats it up and Devcich misses his flick, just like Williamson. No problems for the umpire there. That was hitting the leg stump
bowls length on off stump, the batsman steers it down to third man
this one flies past the outside edge at 143 kph.. Two slips were waiting there. A lazy waft from Taylor as he hardly moved forward to that
gets some width this time and whacks it through point to pick up his first boundary
he stands in the crease and punches the back of length delivery towards mid-off
gets good bounce from just short of length, the batsman hops on the crease to defends this

this is a procession! Irfan's bounce is too hot to handle for Taylor here. It rises from just back of length and catches the shoulder of the bat as the batsman looks to turn it to the leg side.. big leading edge just lobs on the off side and the fielder from point jogs in a few steps to gobble this up
length delivery on the stumps, the batsman defends it to the leg side
on the pads, Guptill flicks it to deep square leg
fires this one down the leg side, easy call for a wide
he waits in the crease and chops the length delivery down to third-man
he goes back and punches the length delivery to mid-off
hops on the crease and whips the length delivery to deep midwicket to pick up a couple
stays in the crease and defends this length  delivery to mid-off
jogs in gently towards the crease and fires a bolt at 143 kph, the batsman defends it down the pitch
gives the bowler a charge only to be beaten by the bounce! That has hit him flush on the grill of his helmet
takes the conventional approach now, dabbed towards off for a quick single
goes back and pushes the back of length delivery to the bowler's right.. He is a bit hurried in his shot
waits on the back foot and punches the length delivery to cover point.. Good bounce for Irfan again but that is not news
he was attempting this shot two balls ago! Hops on the crease and drags the ball from around off stump to deep midwicket. It's a no-ball as well.. a huge one
fires it in the block hole at 146 kph but Guptill manages to squeeze it to the deep backward square leg boundary.. More of an inside edge there
tosses it up on the stumps, the batsman drives it down to long on
he comes forward and pushes the fuller delivery to off, finds the man at cover
flatter and on the pads, Guptill pushes it towards mid-on and calls early for a quick single
comes down the pitch and swings this one to the leg side! It came a little slow for his liking but he waits an extra second before whacking it to the cow corner
flatter and quicker, the batsman is cramped for room. Defends it to the leg side
tossed up delivery, pushed back to the bowler
tossed up delivery on the middle and leg line, driven to long on for a single
goes deep in the crease to a full and flighted delivery, flicks it behind square on the leg side. Looked like he was beaten in the length

this could be another one, or is it? Guptill stretches forward and looks to hit this firmly down the ground, but that heavy swing of the bat has taken him out of the crease. The ball went straight on and Sarfraz whipped the bails in flash.. but Guptill has done well to just slide his foot behind the line in time
tossed up on off, Guptill reaches out and punches it down the ground to long on
full and flighted, eased down to long on for a single
shuffles to the leg side a touch, the bowler follows him with a quicker delivery. Guptill then flicks this one to deep square leg
poor delivery to start with.. he pitches it halfway down the pitch and Guptill pulls it firmly to deep square leg boundary
shorter again but this time Guptill' pull finds the man at deep backward square leg
slower and tossed up this time, Anderson defends it back to the bowler
the slider wide outside off beats the bat. Anderson was looking to play the late cut but was a touch... late
flatter and shorter on off, the batsman flat-bats it past the non-striker for a quick couple
shorter again, the batsman pulls this to deep midwicket to keep strike
slower through the air, Anderson has to wait and he fails to get it away, pushes it down the pitch
uses his feet beautifully this time.. Reaches the pitch of the delivery and hammers it to the sight screen
flatter and quicker, he waits in the crease and whips it to deep midwicket
on the pads this time, easily tucked to square leg for a single
lots of air this time, Anderson drives it to wide long on for a single
full and flighted, driven to wide long on for a single
short ball again from Afridi, the batsman pulls it towards cow corner even though it hasn't bounced to his liking.. Umar Akmal dives at the boundary to keep it in
fuller and flighted, eased to long-off for a single
slower and flatter on the stumps, the batsman dabs it to the vacant midwicket area for an easy single
cuts this one hard as soon as he sees width but this hit straight to point

we have seen it a million times before! The slider from Afridi goes through the gate. This one was slower through the air and Guptill was looking to drive it down the ground, but it sneaks in through the gap to hit the middle. Lala spreads his arms
similar delivery to the one that got Guptill, but Ronchi defends it to the leg side
and he is welcomed with a massive swing of the bat! Slog sweep from outside off, this goes almost as high as the roof and into the second tier behind midwicket. Huge huge hit
flatter delivery on the stumps, defended down the pitch
quicker on the pads, he flicks it to deep midwicket for a single
quicker one but this goes down the leg side
slower this time, the batsman comes forward and defends it down the pitch
flatter delivery on the stumps, the batsman dabs it towards midwicket
marginally short and the batsman flatbats it down to long-on where a fumble allows the batsmen to come back for the second
pushed through outside off but he giftwraps this in width.. Anderson wait and punches it firmly to deep extra cover
looks to drag it towards the leg side but ends up hitting it straight to the bowler
punches this one firmly to deep cover this time
slower and flighted on off, but this is also full, and wide.. Ronchi goes down on his knee and crashes it through extra cover. Superb drive
quicker one on the stumps, pushed towards cover
shorter delivery, easily dragged to deep square leg with a powerful pull
fuller delivery on off, the batsman slices it to third man
he comes down the pitch but the bowler delivers a slower bouncer that messes up with Anderson's timing.. hits his shoulder after he has gone through with the pull
there are two men on the leg side boundary but Anderson has nailed it in the gap.. It's a flat pull, goes along the ground (well almost) for a six to deep square leg
punches this firmly to the bowler
another six in the same region! Short ball, this is flat batted over square leg for second six
top edge! The batsman chased this wide delivery but this gets the edge and lobs behind Hafeez at backward point.. lands safely
slides this one across the left-hander, beats Anderson's cut
slightly shorter outside off, Anderson punches this firmly to long off
he comes forward to this tossed up delivery, toe-ends it to long on for a single
looks for the big sweep but this one slides under the bat
waits in the crease and bunts this firmly to long on for a single
superbly hit! Lots of width and flight given by Lala and Ronchi goes down on his knee to crash it over extra cover.. That races away to the boundary
strolls in and fires this full at 139 kph, but this is down the leg side
short of length outside off, Anderson guides it to third man for a single
he targets the long-on area with a big hit! Moves his front leg out of the way and goes over the infield, doesn't get the timing though and it's hauled back by mid-on
clears his front leg and slices the fuller delivery over point for a couple more
looks to carve this back of length delivery over point but is beaten by the extra bounce.
beautifully hit! this is on the up and through covers. It was length ball on top and he gets on top of this and whacks it along the ground. There was a sweeper in the deep but he had not chance
fires it in the blockhole, it's too quick for the batsman. He gets an inside edge but Sarfraz dives to his left to cut it off
tossed up outside off, the batsman drags it to wide long on for a single. Brings the half-century of the partnership
quicker delivery on the stumps, the batsman hits it down the pitch to the bowler
comes forward and chips the quicker delivery to deep midwicket

whoa! Anderson falls just short of the boundary and his half-century. It looked like one of those big ones the moment he went for the pull but the it started dipping near the boundary and the fielder at deep midwicket took a well-judged running catch on the edge, finishes it with a leap
he is beaten by the quicker one, Ronchi was looking to drive it without getting close to the line
punches this one to deep cover for a single
angles it in from wide of the crease, the batsman cuts it to backward point
nicely disguised slower bouncer! The batsman was looking to play the upper cut but is beaten by the lack of pace
quicker one on the the stumps, Ronchi looks to pull it towards deep midwicket but gets no timing.. that is good for him as the field is deep and he gets enough time to get back for the second
gets no timing as he looks to swing this full toss, this works fine too as it lands short of the fielder at deep midwicket
he reaches out and carves this fuller delivery over the infield for a single to deep cover
slower delivery, the batsman is beaten in his punch shot but he gets a bottom edge on it that runs between the keeper and short third man.. No timing whatsoever but Ronchi keeps ticking
quicker one outside off, beats the bat as Neesham plays down the wrong line
he dabs this one to the leg side to bring Ronchi back on strike
quicker and on the pads, the batsman flat-bats it to deep square leg for a single
full and quick on off stump, Neesham can only dig it out towards cover

now Neesham gets into the swing.. Hammers it over midwicket but more good work by Saad Nasim in the deep.. He leaps to his right now and palms the ball in to the field to prevent six. A hard critic will call it a drop but I am soft
tossed up delivery on the stumps, the batsman eases it to long on
looks for the yorker but it's a low full toss, Neesham is a touch surprised and only manages to push it softly towards wide mid-off
fuller delivery, Ronchi won't mind those.. he clears his front leg and drives it firmly to long off
looks to make some room but Irfan fires it full and just inside the line.. 143 kph.. The batsman can't connect
fuller, Neesham has to go.. He went after it but ended up slicing it to long off. Easy catch for Umar Akmal.
he keeps mistiming his shots! Goes for the pull this time and gets a top edge that lands safely at backward square leg
wants to cramp the batsman but this one goes down the leg side
that's more like it from Irfan.. Digs it on short of length and the extra bounce does the rest, beats the bat comfortably
timberland!! Ronchi goes across the line to the length delivery but this was always coming in from round the wicket.. He misses, he looses his off stump
length delivery wide outside off, the batsman slices it down to third man to get off the mark
he runs a bye after missing the slower bouncer. The batsman was looking to steer it to third man but  was beaten completely
another bye! Tanvir is not impressed with Sarfraz's aims. Another slower ball missed by the batsman
makes room and punches it to mid-off for a single
bowls a slower yorker to finish off the innings.. the batsman can only get an inside edge to short fine leg
